Package Controllers

Class HolidayManager

java.lang.Object
Controllers.HolidayManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Manager
public class HolidayManager extends Object implements Manager
This class handles the CRUD (create, read, update, delete) methods for Holidays. Only Admins have access to the methods within this Class. This class implements the read and write methods in the Manager interface. When creating or updating Holiday dates, the following constraints are present: 1) Month input must be greater than or equals 1 and lesser than or equals 12 2) Day of Month input must be greater than or equals 1 and lesser than or equals 31

  • Method Details

    • createHoliday

      public static void createHoliday(Scanner sc)
      Create method to add new Holiday to database
      Parameters:
      sc - Takes in the scanner to instantiate variables within the function itself. Admins will input the year, month, date separately. New date object will then be create with these 3 fields. InputMismatchException: UNCHECKED --> Thrown when user inputs an invalid format

    • printHolidayList

      public static void printHolidayList()
      Read method Print all holidays in the database

    • updateHoliday

      public static void updateHoliday(Scanner sc)
      Update Method
      Parameters:
      sc - takes in scanner to update fields within the function Allows admins to update existing holidays. All fields are allowed to be updated. Holidays are queried according to their Name Users must input the Holiday Name exact (case-sensitive) including its Year in the name e.g. Christmas 2022

    • deleteHoliday

      public static void deleteHoliday(Scanner sc)
      Delete method
      Parameters:
      sc - takes in scanner to ask which holiday is to be deleted delete holiday based on holidayName

    • isHoliday

      public static boolean isHoliday(String holidayDate)
      Validation for holiday
      Parameters:
      holidayDate - of format YYYY-MM-DD
      Returns:
      boolean value if the date is a holiday or not

    • checkInput

      public static int checkInput(String input) throws IllegalArgumentException
      This method validates the String input of users and removes the problems of accepting integer input through the Scanner.
      Parameters:
      input - String input by current user.
      Returns:
      the integer representation of the input if parsing is successful.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - UNCHECKED --> thrown when user input fails to be parsed as an integer.
